Description: THESE FUNDS SUPPORT THE FURTHER DEVELOPMENT AND ADMINISTRATION OF THE TRIBE'S WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND CERTIFICATIONS PROGRAM. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO FINALIZE TRIBE'S WATER QUALITY STANDARDS FOR EPA APPROVAL. THE TRIBE WILL ALSO PERFORM OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ON THE PURPOSE AND IMPORTANCE OF DEVELOPING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS.   THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $28,500.

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANTS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL USE THIS MULTIPURPOSE FUNDING TO UNDERTAKE THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS: REVISIONS AND UPDATES TO THE HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT WITH EPA; INVESTIGATION OF THE MINERAL KING ORPHAN SITE TO CONDUCT SOIL CHARACTERIZATION AND IDENTIFY POTENTIALLY RESPONSIBLE PARTIES; ENHANCEMENTS TO THE GRANTEE'S ENVIROSTOR SYSTEM FOR ELECTRONIC TRANSFER OF FINANCIAL ASSURANCE DATA TO RCRAINFO AND ELECTONIC INSPECTION TOOLS FOR MORE TIMELY AND ACCURATE TRANSFER OF DATA TO RCRAINFO.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $146,092, OF WHICH $50,000 IS SET ASIDE FOR EPA IN-KIND SERVICES.

THIS PROJECT WILL UPDATE THE CALIFORNIA AIR RESOURCES BOARD'S (CARB) EMISSIONS INVENTORY FOR SOLVENT CLEANING AND DEGREASING.  CARB WILL HIRE A CONTRACTOR TO EVALUATE AVAILABLE DATA AND DEVELOP A METHODOLOGICAL APPROACH FOR UPDATING THE INVENTORY FOR THIS CATEGORY. TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE, THE CONTRACTOR WILL SUPPLY CARB WITH ALL TOOLS AND INFORMATION NECESSARY TO EXECUTE THE APPROACH.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $128,518.    PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO FEBRUARY 1, 2020.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE SHOSHONE PAIUTE TRIBE OF THE DUCK VALLEY RESERVATION AND ADDRESSES THE TRIBES' CWA 106 PROGRAM 'MANAGEMENT OF WATER POLLUTION PREVENTION PROGRAM' AND SUPPORTING THE TRIBES' CAPACITY TO MONITOR WATER POLLUTION AT ALREADY IDENTIFIED AND SELECTED SITES ON THE DUCK VALLEY INDIAN RESERVATION. THIS CAPACITY HAS LONG BEEN UNDERDEVELOPED IN THIS RURAL AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY. THE FUNDING WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE LICENSE TO USE NEARMAP SOFTWARE.  NEARMAP PROVIDES CLOUD BASED GEOSPATIAL INFORMATION SERVICES, WHICH INCLUDE AERIAL SURVEYS (PHOTOGRAPHS) AND DATA. THE DEPARTMENT OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES CONTROL (DTSC) WILL USE THIS SERVICE FOR EMERGENCY RESPONSE ASSISTANCE, MANAGING COMPLIANCE OF OPERATING PERMITTED FACILITIES THAT RESIDE IN VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES AND OVERSEEING THE CLEANUP OF SITES ALSO LOCATED IN THESE COMMUNITIES. ITS USE WITHIN DTSC WOULD INCLUDE GATHERING DATA AND EVALUATING SITES FOR POST-DISASTER EMERGENCY RESPONSE REMOVALS, EVALUATING POTENTIAL RISKS TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AFTER AN EMERGENCY, IDENTIFYING VISUAL EVIDENCE OF A RELEASE, IDENTIFYING CLEANUP SITE PROGRESS, MEASURING EXCAVATIONS USING 3D IMAGERY, MONITORING FOR CHANGES TO PERMITTED UNITS OVER TIME TO DETERMINE UNPERMITTED MODIFICATIONS, COMMUNICATING DETAILS OF SITE CLEANUPS WITH THE PUBLIC USING UP TO DATE AND HIGH RESOLUTION IMAGERY, AND USING LICENSED IMAGERY IN PUB

THE CALIFORNIA AIR RESOURCES BOARD (CARB) WILL USE THE MULTIPURPOSE GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS TO HIRE A CONTRACTOR TO HELP PRODUCE AN EXTENDABLE VIDEO SERIES THAT ACHIEVES THE GOAL'S IDENTIFIED BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS.  SPECIFICALLY, THESE FUNDS WILL ENABLE CARB TO PROCURE A CONTRACT FOR VIDEO PRODUCTION SERVICES.  THE CONTRACTOR WILL THEN IDENTIFY AN APPROPRIATE FRAMEWORK AND DEVELOP THE VIDEO SERIES OF A 12-MONTH PERIOD.  THE DELIVERABLES FOR THIS EFFORT ARE A COMPLETED VIDEO SERIES  THAT COVERS THE CRITERIA REQUESTED BY THE PUBLIC.  EACH TWO-THREE-MINUTE VIDEO WILL COVER TOPICS INCLUDING:  OVERVIEW AND AGENCY ROLES, REGIONAL VS LOCAL POLLUTANT TYPES, HEALTH EFFECTS OF POLLUTANTS, AREA, MOBILE, AND STATIONARY SOURCES, AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS, EMISSIONS INVENTORY, MOBILE SOURCE CONTROL, STATIONARY SOURCE CONTROL, AND ENFORCEMENT.

THIS GRANT WILL BE UTILIZED FOR WELLSTAR (WELL STATE TRACKING AND REPORTING) TECHNICAL SUPPORT THAT WILL IMPROVE THE DATA COLLECTION QUALITY OF THE APPLICATION AND ASSIST THE PROGRAM.  PROGRAM STAFF WILL PROVIDE THE SUPPORT TO INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL USERS OF WELLSTAR ENSURING USERS CAN SUBMIT APPLICATION IN A STANDARDIZED FORMAT, AND ADHERE TO STATUTES AND REGULATIONS.  UPDATE ITS DATABASE MANAGEMENT AND INTEGRATE ALL ITS LEGACY DATA SOURCES INTO ONE SINGLE SYSTEM. THIS PROJECT CALLED WELLSTAR.   IT IS AN ELECTRONIC DATABASE UNDER ONGOING DEVELOPMENT TO BETTER HANDLE DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS, STREAMLINE OPERATIONS AND PROCESSES, AND ADHERE TO REQUIREMENTS IN THE STATUTES AND REGULATIONS. IT ALLOWS OIL AND GAS OPERATORS TO SUBMIT REQUIRED INFORMATION IN A STANDARDIZED FORMAT AND AUTOMATICALLY POPULATES REPEATABLE DATA.

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANTS. THE IOWA DNR IS WORKING TOWARDS DIGITIZING ALL PAPER RECORDS FOR EVENTUAL UPLOAD TO A NEW ONLINE PUBLIC RECORDS SYSTEM (OPEN TEXT) THAT WILL ALLOW THE PUBLIC TO HAVE 24/7 ACCESS TO ALL RECORDS. THIS AGREEMENTS FUNDING WILL BE USED TO COVER SCANNING COSTS FOR PAPER RECORDS STILL ON SHELVES FOR STATE IMPLEMENTATION PLANS, RULEMAKINGS, BUDGETING AND CONTRACTS, AND AMBIENT MONITORING THAT ARE NOT ALREADY STORED ELECTRONICALLY, TO ALLOW THESE RECORDS TO BE EVENTUALLY ADDED TO THE NEW ONLINE PUBLIC RECORDS SYSTEM. THIS AGREEMENTS FUNDING WILL ALSO BE USED FOR EASY AIR ENHANCEMENTS. EASY AIR IS A CONVENIENT, EFFICIENT APPLICATION THAT STREAMLINES THE PERMITTING PROCESS. 
THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF DIGITIZING RECORDS INCLUDE ENHANCED ELECTRONIC ACCESS TO RECORDS AND EASY PUBLIC, DEPARTMENT, AND EPA ACCESS TO INFORMATION FOR USE IN ENVIRONMENTAL DECISION-MAKING. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF EASY AIR ENHANCEMENTS INCLUDE ENHANCED ELECTRONIC ACCESS TO FACILITY PERMITTING RECORDS AND EASY PUBLIC, DEPARTMENT, AND EPA ACCESS TO INFORMATION FOR USE IN ENVIRONMENTAL DECISION-MAKING. THE PRIMARY AND DIRECT BENEFICIARY(IES) ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF IOWA.

THE RECIPIENT PLAN TO RESTORE EXISTING SEMI-PERMANENT WETLANDS AND CREATE NEW SEASONAL WETLANDS BY IMPROVING WATER CONVEYANCES ACROSS THE SOUTH PARK WILDLIFE HABITAT MANAGEMENT AREA (SOUTH PARK WHMA).  THE PROJECT WILL DEMONSTRATE RESTORATION TECHNIQUES TO IMPROVE HABITAT FOR WILDLIFE (E.G., ELK, MIGRATORY BIRDS), WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY IMPROVING WATER QUALITY BY REDUCING POINT SOURCE AND NONPOINT SOURCE NUTRIENT LOADS.  FINALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PLAN TO HIGHLIGHT HOW WETLAND RESTORATION CAN BE UTILIZED TO IMPROVE RECREATIONAL  OPPORTUNITIES (E.G, HIKING, HUNTING, BIRD WATCHING) FOR THE PUBLIC.

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANTS. THERE ARE THREE PROJECTS:  1.  STORMWATER MONITORING AND INVENTORY PROJECT; 2.  EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, AND; 3.  UTILIZE CITY OF KALISPELL AS A PILOT FOR DRY-WEATHER INSPECTION OF OUTFALLS.

OUTPUTS WILL INCLUDE ADDITIONAL HYDROLOGY INFORMATION IN A REPORT ON CENTRAL BASIN WETLANDS, A TABLE OF PLANT SPECIES WITH FUNCTIONAL ATTRIBUTES, AND A SHORT REPORT SUMMARIZING THE RESULTS OF THE PLANT ATTRIBUTE VALIDATION AND ANALYSIS.

ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES/OUTPUTS/DELIVERABLES AND TIMEFRAME/SCHEDULE:
THE WYOMING OIL AND GAS CONSERVATION COMMISSION (WOGCC) IS CURRENTLY IN DEVELOPMENT ON AN UPGRADE OF ITS ELECTRONIC UIC DATABASE.  THE NEW APPLICATION WILL ALLOW THE WOGCC BETTER DATA TRACKING, RECORD KEEPING AND REPORTING, AND INCREASED UIC PROGRAM COMPLIANCE.  

THE WOGCC WILL BE MORE EFFECTIVE IN REGULATING THE UIC PROGRAM AND IN REPORTING WYOMING CLASS II UIC DATA TO EPA AND THE PUBLIC.  IN ADDITION, THE WOGCC WILL INCREASE COMPLIANCE IN THE CLASS II UIC PROGRAM BY BEING MORE EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE.  BY AUTOMATING BUSINESS RULES IN THE NEW DATABASE SYSTEM, THE AGENCY STAFF WILL BE ABLE TO FOCUS ON MORE COMPLEX REGULATORY ISSUES AND WORK WITH INDUSTRY TO UNDERSTAND AND REMAIN COMPLIANT WITH THE UIC REGULATIONS.  

THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE UIC APPLICATION IS SCHEDULED FOR COMPLETION MID-CALENDAR YEAR 2022.  ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT MAY OCCUR AGAIN LATE IN 2021 OR 2022 DURING DEVELOPMENT OF THE WOGCC HEARING APPLICATION WHICH WILL ALLOW FURTHER INTEGRATION OF THE UIC APPLICATION WITH THE AGENCY&RSQUOANDS PROCESS FOR SCHEDULING AND TRACKING OF HEARINGS INCLUDING THE HEARINGS AND PUBLIC MEETINGS HELD AS PART OF THE UIC/AQUIFER EXEMPTION PROCESS.

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM SUPERVISION (PWSS) ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANT. DESCRIPTION:THE MULTIPURPOSE GRANT (MPG) FUNDING IS BEING PROVIDED AS IN-KIND ASSISTANCE WHICH WILL BE DIRECTED TO A CONTRACT TO SUPPORT PUERTO RICO'S SAFE DRINKING WATER INFORMATION SYSTEM (SDWIS) DATABASE PROJECT. THE CONTRACTOR WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO THE PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (PRDOH) TO BE ABLE TO BETTER USE SDWIS TO MANAGE DATA MORE EFFECTIVELY. THE SUPPORT ALSO WILL INCLUDE MAINTENANCE AND UPGRADES OF ALL SDWIS PRODUCTS, AS THE SDWIS APPLICATION INCLUDES A SUITE OF PRODUCTS USED TO TRACK COMPLIANCE WITH THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT REGULATIONS AND TO REPORT TO EPA. ACTIVITIES:THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED BY THE CONTRACTOR:

 1 - ESTABLISH GUIDANCE ON SDWIS ERRORS FOR VIOLATIONS AND ENFORCEMENTS
 2 - PROVIDE DATA CLEANUP FOR LOCATIONAL DATA (FACILITY, WELLS, INTAKES, TREATMENT PLANTS, AND STORAGE) TO ENSURE ACCURATE DATA
 3 - SDWIS TRAINING
 4 - ESTABLISH BUSINESS RULES, CREATE PROCEDURES TO INTEGRATE PR SDWIS APPLICATION WITH ALL EPA HQ SDWIS PRODUCTS
 5 - ENHANCEMENTS OF PR SDWIS DATABASE TO CREATE REPORTS, BUILD QUERIES AND STREAMLINE THE UPLOAD PROCESS
 6 - MIGRATION OF DATA FROM ONE APPLICATION TO A NEW SDWIS APPLICATION

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANTS. SUMMARY OF PROPOSED TASKS:  1)  COMPILE GIS DATA INTO USEABLE FORMAT FROM LAKE COUNTY AND CONFEDERATED SALISH & KOOTENAI TRIBE (SOURTHERN BASIN) AND CREATE LAYERS/MAPPING FOR INCLUSION IN MODEL; 2)  PROIVDE GIS ANALYSIS OF MODELS (SEPTIC AGE/RISK AND PERCENTAGE OF PRIVATE LAND IN EACH RISK CATEGORY);  3)  SUPPORT THE FLATHEAD BASIN COMMISSIONS ONSITE WASTEWATER TREATMENT COMMITTEE; 4)  PRODUCE AN FBC PROJECT REPORT, BUILIDING UPON THE EXISTING FLATHEAD COUNTY GIS REPORT, INCLUDING GIS LAYER TEMPLATE CONSISTENT WITH LAYERS PREVIOUSLY DEVELOPED; AND 5)  GROUND TRUTH AND VALIDATE/CALIBRATE MODEL RESULTS UTILIZING SYNTHETIC DNA TECHNOLOGY (PHASE 1).

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE PAMUNKEY INDIAN TRIBE TO DEVELOP ITS NATURAL RESOURCES DEPARTMENT AND HIRE A NATURAL RESOURCES DIRECTOR. THE DIRECTOR WILL TAKE TRAINING AND BEGIN TO ADVOCATE FOR THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL INTERESTS BY ATTENDING MEETINGS, PARTICIPATING ON CONSULTATIONS, AND NETWORKING WITH OTHER LOCAL, STATE, FEDERAL, ACADEMIC AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE DIRECTOR WILL ALSO DEVELOP AND FINALIZE AN EPA/TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN (ETEP), A QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN, AND FINANCIAL GRANT MANAGEMENT POLICES AND PROCEDURES. ACTIVITIES:THE DIRECTOR WILL BE SETTING UP ADMINISTRATIVE AND FINANCIAL POLICIES TO ENSURE PROPER EXECUTION OF THE GRANT. THE TRIBE WILL BE ATTENDING MEETINGS, CONSULTATIONS, AND OTHER EVENTS THAT ARE PERTINENT TO THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL INTERESTS AND PRIORITIES. THE GRANT WILL PROVIDE FOR REFUSE SERVICE TO RESIDENTS AND THE GOVERNMENT ON THE RESERVATION. LASTLY, THE TRIBE WILL BE DEVELOPING AND FINALIZING THE EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN (ETEP). SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FOR THIS PROJECT ARE THE HIRING OF A NATURAL RESOURCES DIRECTOR THAT WILL OVERSEE EXECUTION OF THE GRANT. THE NATURAL RESOURCES DIRECTOR WILL OVERSEE THE YEAR-LONG REFUSE SERVICE CONTRACT FOR RESIDENTS AND THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PAMUNKEY INDIAN TRIBE RESERVATION. LASTLY THE NATURAL RESOURCES DIRECTOR WILL DEVELOP AND FINALIZE INTERNAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES ON PROPER EXECUTION OF THE GAP GRANT. THE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE PAMUNKEY INDIAN TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW ISDA TO UPDATE THEIR PESTICIDE APPLICATOR TESTS AND TRANSLATE THEM TO SPANISH. MANY AGRICULTURE WORKERS ARE SPANISH SPEAKING AND THIS WILL ENSURE THEY CAN UNDERSTAND THE TEST MATERIAL AND PROVIDE ADDITIONAL EMPLOYMENT AND PROMOTIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE APPLICATOR TEST DEVELOPMENT AND REVIEW, TRANSLATION INTO SPANISH, AND DEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL AND TEST MATERIALS. IT WILL ENSURE THE SPANISH SPEAKING PESTICIDE APPLICATORS ARE PROTECTED, THE PUBLIC IS PROTECTED AND THE ENVIRONMENT IS PROTECTED FROM THE HARMFUL EFFECTS OF PESTICIDES.ACTIVITIES:ISDA WILL WORK WITH A CONTRACTOR TO DEVELOP AND REVIEW THE TESTS, TRANSLATE THEM INTO SPANISH, AND PRINT EDUCATIONAL AND TEST MATERIALS FOR THEIR STAFF AND TO SHARE WITH SPANISH SPEAKING APPLICATORS WHO WISH TO BECOME A PESTICIDE APPLICATOR. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THREE TESTS, RESTRICTED USE PESTICIDE, ORNAMENTAL HERBICIDE, AND CHEMIGATION. THE TESTS WILL BE REVIEWED, TRANSLATED INTO SPANISH, AND EDUCATIONAL AND TEST MATERIALS WILL BE PRINTED FOR DISTRIBUTION. THIS WILL ENSURE ADDITIONAL EMPLOYMENT AND ADVANCEMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR SPANISH SPEAKING FARMWORKERS. THIS EFFORT WILL HELP ENSURE THE PESTICIDE APPLICATORS, THE PUBLIC AND THE ENVIRONMENT ARE PROTECTED FROM HARMFUL EFFECTS OF PESTICIDES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROGRAM SUPPORTS THE OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT. OF LABOR (ODOL) IN DEVELOPING AND MAINTAINING COMPLIANCE MONITORING PROGRAMS TO PREVENT OR ELIMINATE UNREASONABLE RISKS TO HEALTH OR THE ENVIRONMENT ASSOCIATED WITH CHEMICAL SUBSTANCES OR MIXTURES IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. OUTCOMES INCLUDE A SAFER ENVIRONMENT IN SCHOOLS, PROTECTION OF HEALTH IN STUDENTS AND SCHOOL PERSONNEL, AND IMPROVED AWARENESS OF ASBESTOS SAFETY MEASURES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS OF THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA.

RESULTS WILL SUPPORT THE PUEBLO'S WATER QUALITY STANDARDS CEREMONIAL USE CRITERIA. 
ACTIVITIES:
THE RECIPIENT WILL:
1. REFINE AND MAINTAIN TECHNICAL EXPERTISE TO IMPLEMENT THE PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA'S MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING PROJECT
2. CONDUCT MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING SAMPLING EVENTS AT ESTABLISHED WATER QUALITY SITES ON THE RIO JEMEZ AND RIO GRANDE.
3. ANALYZE EXISTING AND NEWLY ACQUIRED MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING DATA AND WATER QUALITY DATA TO TRACK EXISTING AND IDENTIFY EMERGING WATER QUALITY ISSUES TO PROTECT EXISTING AND FUTURE TRIBAL WATER USES.
OUTCOMES:
DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:
1. QUARTERLY REPORTS AT THE END OF CALENDAR MONTHS JANUARY, APRIL, AND JULY.
2. A COMPREHENSIVE FINAL REPORT TO INCLUDE A DISCUSSION OF WORK PLAN OBJECTIVES, OUTPUTS, MILESTONES, OUTCOMES, AND DELIVERABLES OF FY22.
3. MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING PROJECT RESULTS TO BE INCLUDED IN THE FINAL REPORT.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE:
1. INCREASED MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING TECHNICAL CAPACITY OF STAFF.
2. CONTINUED PRESENCE IN MEETINGS, WORKSHOPS, AND CONFERENCES REGARDING E. COLI FECAL INDICATOR BACTERIA, MICROBIAL SOURCE TRACKING, AND WATER QUALITY MONITORING.
3. ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING OF THE POTENTIAL SOURCES OF BACTERIAL PATHOGENS IN THE RIO JEMEZ E. COLI.
4. INITIATE THE IDENTIFICATION SPECIFIC MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES THAT MAY BE USEFUL IN REDUCING BACTERIAL CONTAMINATION TO THE RIO JEMEZ AND TO IDENTIFY AREAS OF GREATER FECAL CONTAMINATION RISK TO BETTER PREDICT HEALTH ADVISORIES FOR THE COMMUNITY.

THE PRIMARY AND DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE PUEBLO OF SANTA ANA'S RESIDENTS.

THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF WATER RESOURCES (IDWR) GROUND WATER PROTECTION (GWP) SECTION PROPOSES TO EXPAND THE NUMBER OF INSPECTIONS DURING CRITICAL PHASES OF THE WATER WELL CONSTRUCTION PROCESS. CRITICAL PHASES INCLUDE WELL SEAL PLACEMENT AND WELL DECOMMISSIONING. ONE OF THE GREATEST THREATS TO IDAHO'S UNDERGROUND SOURCE WATER IS VERTICAL MOVEMENT OF CONTAMINANTS FROM GROUND LEVEL TO AND ACROSS THE AQUIFER SYSTEMS SEPARATED BY NATURAL GEOLOGIC CONFINING UNITS. PROPERLY SEALED AND DECOMMISSIONED WELLS CAN PREVENT (1) SURFACE CONTAMINATION FROM REACHING THE UPPER AQUIFER UNITS AND (2) COMINGLING OF AQUIFER UNITS WITH VARYING DEGREES OF PRESSURE, TEMPERATURE, AND WATER QUALITY. THE NUMBER OF WATER WELLS BEING CONSTRUCTED ANNUALLY HAS GENERALLY INCREASED OVER THE YEARS; CURRENTLY OVER 4,000 WELLS ARE BEING CONSTRUCTED ANNUALLY MANY OF WHICH ARE INTENDED TO REPLACE EXISTING WELLS THAT WERE NOT CONSTRUCTED TO CURRENT STANDARDS (IDAPA 37.03.09) AND HAVE FAILED OVER TIME. THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANTS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL USE THE MULTIPURPOSE FUNDING TO CONTINUE DEVELOPMENT OF A PREDICTIVE MODEL FOR HABS ON THE OHIO RIVER. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: (1) FIX BROKEN LINKS TO THE USACOE FLOW DATA WHICH ARE NECESSARY FOR THE HAB APP TO WORK PROPERLY; (2) IMPROVE DISPLAY OF WATER QUALITY DATA AND RISK INFORMATION THROUGH THE ADDITION OF MODEL RESULT GRAPHING; (3) ADD CONTINUOUS HABS MONITORING DATA FROM PIKE ISLAND AND MELDAHL STATIONS. THE TWO ADDITIONAL STATIONS WILL ADD TO THE AMOUNT OF DATA THAT CAN BE DISPLAYED FOR THE OHIO RIVER IN THE APP; AND (4) INVESTIGATE MIGRATING THE APP TO A MORE STABLE COMPUTER-BASED PLATFORM. THE PROJECT WILL ASSURE OHIO RIVER VALLEY WATER SANITATION COMMISSION WATER QUALITY MONITORING EFFORTS FULFILL THE NEEDS AND PRIORITIES OF THE COMMISSION AND THE MEMBER STATES IN A COST EFFECTIVE AND SCIENTIFIC MANNER.

THE FUNDING WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT TESTING OF SOILS THROUGH LABORATORY ANALYSIS IN DEVELOPING A MODEL TO IMPROVE ASSESSMENT AND PREDICTION OF FAILURES RELATED TO ON-SITE SEWAGE SYSTEMS (OSS).   ADDITIONAL LABORATORY TESTING IS NEEDED TO DEFINE, DELINEATE, AND CATEGORIZE THESE EXPANSIVE SOILS, AND TO MAKE OSS SYSTEM REGULATORY DECISIONS BASED UPON SOIL CHARACTERISTICS TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH, THE ENVIRONMENT, AND CITIZENS' INVESTMENTS.  IN ADDITION, THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO IMPROVE IN ABILITY TO ACCURATELY MONITOR INDOOR AIR CONTAMINANTS BY SENDING SEVERAL PIECES OF AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT BACK FOR FACTORY CALIBRATION.  THE PROGRAM WILL SEND TWO SAS MOLD SAMPLERS, TWO CO2/CO METERS, AND A JEROME MERCURY METER IN FOR UPDATES AND CALIBRATION.  THIS EQUIPMENT IS USED TO ASSIST IN VARIOUS TYPES OF ENVIRONMENTAL SURVEILLANCE WORK TO REDUCE PUBLIC HEALTH HAZARDS AND PROMOTE RELATED POSITIVE PUBLIC HEALTH OUTCOMES; AND FOR FURTHER CAPACITY BUILDING RELATED TO THE IDOH INDOOR AIR PROGRAM A

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANTS. SPECIFICALLY, THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (DHHS) WILL USE THIS MULTIPURPOSE FUNDING TO DEVELOP A WELL STEWARDSHIP AND MANAGEMENT PROGRAM THAT WILL HELP TO PROTECT THE STATE'S DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES.  BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE THE RESIDENTS OF MICHIGAN.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT IS THAT INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES WILL GAIN KNOWLEDGE ON HOW BEST TO MANAGE AND PROTECT THEIR DRINKING WATER WELLS FROM CONTAMINATION.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR OHIO DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (ODH) PROVIDE DATA TO STAKEHOLDERS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES (PFAS) WATER CONTAMINATION IN OHIO'S DRINKING WATERS.  SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: IDENTIFY LOCATIONS WHERE PFAS WAS PRESENT IN A PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM SAMPLE, AND THEN PRIORITIZE AND SAMPLE NEARBY NON-PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM WELLS AND OTHER AVAILABLE SOURCE WATERS TO BETTER DEFINE THE NATURE AND EXTENT OF THE SIX PFAS IMPACT ON OHIO'S SOURCE WATERS.  ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS:  INCREASE CAPACITY TO PRIORITIZE AND SAMPLE POTENTIALLY PFAS CONTAMINATED SITES IN OHIO; IDENTIFY AND FURTHER UNDERSTAND THE PREVALENCE OF PFAS CONTAMINATION IN OHIO'S GROUND WATERS: AND INCREASE STAKEHOLDER KNOWLEDGE OF PFAS CONTAMINATION IN OHIO.

TO COMPLY WITH THE NEW FEDERAL CERTIFICATION AND TRAINING RULE, VERMONT WILL NEED TO UPDATE ITS CERTIFICATION SOFTWARE. VERMONT WILL NEED TO CREATE SUB-CATEGORIES FOR PRIVATE APPLICATORS IN ITS COMPUTER SOFTWARE SYSTEM. CURRENTLY VERMONT HAS COMMODITY GROUPS LISTED FOR PRIVATE APPLICATORS, BUT THESE DO NOT TRIGGER LICENSING REQUIREMENTS. THE NEW SUB-CATEGORIES OF AERIAL, AND SOIL AND NON-SOIL FUMIGATION WILL NEED TO BE DEVELOPED AND CODED INTO THE CURRENT COMPUTER SYSTEM. ADDITIONALLY, OTHER COMPUTER CODE WILL NEED TO BE ALTERED TO COMPLETE OVERALL COMPLIANCE WITH CERTIFICATION AND TRAINING RULE. THIS WILL BE DONE EITHER IN THROUGH ACCLAIM OR SALESFORCE SOFTWARE.

THE AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANTS, STATE INDOOR RADON GRANTS (SIRG).  SPECIFICALLY THE RECIPIENT, THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH (CTDPH), WILL USE THIS MULTIPURPOSE GRANT FUNDING TO WORK WITH A MEDIA CONSULTANT TO DEVELOP NEW, CREATIVE RADON MESSAGING AND DISTRIBUTE THAT MESSAGING STATEWIDE THROUGH A VARIETY OF APPROACHES INCLUDING, PAID RADIO SPOTS, SOCIAL MEDIA OUTREACH, AND STREAMING TELEVISION ADVERTISING.  ALL RADON EDUCATION AND OUTREACH EFFORTS WILL BE DESIGNED WITH THE ANTICIPATED ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOME OF INCREASING RADON AWARENESS, MEASUREMENT ACTIVITIES, AND ENCOURAGE THE INSTALLATION OF RADON MITIGATION SYSTEMS TO ACTIVELY REDUCE RADON EXPOSURE, WHICH IS THE LEADING CAUSE OF LUNG CANCER IN NON-SMOKERS.

THE PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF SAMPLING RESIDENTIAL DRINKING WATER WELLS, CROPS AND LIVESTOCK NEAR A LOCAL DAIRY FARM IN FAIRFIELD, MAINE. THESE RESIDENCES ARE ABUTTERS TO THE DAIRY FARM WITH KNOWN PFAS CONTAMINATION. PAST SAMPLING EFFORTS BY THE STATE OF MAINE HAVE DETERMINED APPROXIMATELY TEN PERCENT (10%) NEARBY RESIDENTIAL WELLS SAMPLED HAVE COMBINED PFOA AND PFOS LEVELS GREATER THAN 1,000 PARTS PER TRILLION).  THE APPLICANT WILL CONTINUE TO SAMPLE DRINKING WATER FROM THESE PRIVATE WELLS AND SAMPLE ADJACENT CROPS AND LIVESTOCK MANURE TO CHARACTERIZE THE SITE.  THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE RISK ANALYSES OF THE GARDEN PRODUCE AND SOILS TO IDENTIFY RISKS TO HOMEOWNERS.

THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS ACTIVITIES THAT COMPLEMENT EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANTS.   SPECIFICALLY THE RECIPIENT WILL USE THIS MULTIPURPOSE FUNDING TO COMPLY WITH THE CHANGES TO 40 CFR PART 171; THE CERTIFICATION AND TRAINING OF PESTICIDE APPLICATORS. THE REVISIONS PROVIDE ASSURANCE THAT CERTIFIED APPLICATORS, AND NON-CERTIFIED APPLICATORS UNDER THEIR DIRECT SUPERVISION, ARE COMPETENT TO USE RESTRICTED USE PESTICIDES (RUPS) IN A MANNER THAT WILL NOT CAUSE UNREASONABLE ADVERSE EFFECTS ON HUMAN HEALTH OR THE ENVIRONMENT.   THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURAL RESOURCES (MDAR) HAS DETERMINED THAT TO BE COMPLIANT WITH THE CHANGES TO 40 CFR PART 171, THE DEPARTMENT WILL NEED TO DO THE FOLLOWING:  - REVIEW ALL EXISTING EXAMS TO ENSURE THE CONTENT COMPLIES WITH THE NEW REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH BY THE RULE,  - REVIEW ALL EXISTING STUDY MANUALS,  - UPDATE ANY EXAMS THAT MAY BE DEFICIENT,  - ADD NEW EXAMS THAT ARE NOT CURRENTLY OFFERED; AND  - PRINT NEW EXAMS IF CHANGED

LASTLY, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE NEW OR REVISED PERMIT FORMS AS NECESSARY BASED ON ADOPTING NSR IN INDIAN COUNTRY IN THE TRIBE'S TRIBAL IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (TIP).
